if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addControllerRole(uint8,address)":{"custom:function-name":"addControllerRole","details":"this function is used to add controller roles with ease in place of grantRole","params":{"account":"account to give role to","role":"0 - BOT | 1 - Caller | 2 - ERC"}},"call(address,bytes)":{"custom:function-name":"call","details":"this function is used to call other contracts from the controller contract","params":{"callData":"the call data","targetContract":"the target contract being called by the controller"},"returns":{"_0":"data the return data from the call"}},"callBatch((address,bool,bytes)[])":{"custom:function-name":"callBatch","custom:sub-param":"`target` - the target contract`allowFailure` - whether to allow failure or not`callData` - the call data to pass on the call","details":"this function is used to batch call other contracts using multicall3","params":{"calls":"an array of multicall3 call parameters"},"returns":{"_0":"multicall3ReturnData the multicall3 return data"}},"callBatchValue((address,bool,uint256,bytes)[])":{"custom:function-name":"callBatch","custom:sub-param":"`target` - the target contract`allowFailure` - whether to allow failure or not`value` - the msg.value or the ETH amount to send`callData` - the call data to pass on the call","details":"this function is used to batch call other contracts using multicall3 with value","params":{"calls":"an array of multicall3 call with value parameters"},"returns":{"_0":"multicall3ReturnData the multicall3 return data"}},"changeControllerOwner(address)":{"custom:function-name":"changeControllerOwner","details":"this function is used to tranfer ownership and all roles from one account to another while also removing all permissions on the previous account","params":{"newOwner":"new controller owner"}},"constructor":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow":"constructor","details":"_disableInitializers prevents future reinitializations [_disableInitializers](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/5.x/api/proxy#Initializable-_disableInitializers--) for more info"},"createVault(address,address,address,string)":{"custom:function-name":"createVault","details":"this function is used by the controller to create vaults on behalf of the users","params":{"projectName":"the project name of the vault","projectOwner":"the owner the the vault","rewardToken":"the erc20 token address to reward users with","targetVaultFactory":"the address of the vault factory used to create the vault"},"returns":{"_0":"vault the address of the created vault"}},"feeReceiver()":{"custom:function-name":"feeReceiver","details":"this function is used to get the current fee receiver set on the controller contract","returns":{"_0":"reeReceiver the fee receiver used as reference for fee receivers on factory generated contracts that's called by the controller contract"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasControllerRole(uint8,address)":{"custom:function-name":"removeControllerRole","details":"this function is used to check if an account has a specific controller role","params":{"account":"account to check role against","role":"0 - BOT | 1 - Caller | 2 - ERC"},"returns":{"_0":"hasControllerRole the bool result if the controller has the role"}},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address)":{"custom:function-name":"initialize","details":"this is used in palce of a constructor to initialize a proxy's state using this implemetation's logic","params":{"_feeReceiver":"the fee receiver","initialAdmin":"the admin account | Recommended to be a Multi-Sig Wallet","initialBot":"the bot that will interact with the controller"}},"multicallAddress()":{"custom:function-name":"multicallAddress","details":"this function is used to check which multicall contract the controller is using","returns":{"_0":"multicall the multicall address the controller is using"}},"owner()":{"custom:function-name":"owner","details":"this function shows the current owner/admin of the contract","returns":{"_0":"owner address of the current owner/admin of the contract"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"removeControllerRole(uint8,address)":{"custom:function-name":"removeControllerRole","details":"this function is used to remove controller roles with ease in place of revokeRole","params":{"account":"account to remove role for","role":"0 - BOT | 1 - Caller | 2 - ERC"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setFeeReceiver(address)":{"custom:function-name":"setFeeReceiver","details":"this function is used to change the fee receiver address","params":{"newFeeReceiver":"the new fee receiver address"}},"setMulticallAddress(address)":{"custom:function-name":"setMulticallAddress","details":"this function is used to change the multicall contract address used by the contract","params":{"newMulticallContract":"the new multicall contract address"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"transferERC20Token(address,address,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"transferERC20Token","details":"this function is used to transfer ERC20 tokens owned by the controller contract to another address","params":{"amount":"the amount of tokens to send","receiver":"the receiver of the token","tokenAddress":"the ERC20 token address"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"vaultReward(address,address,uint256)":{"custom:function-name":"vaultReward","details":"this function is used to interact with a target vault's single target reward function","params":{"amount":"the amount of reward to send","targetVault":"the target vault contract","to":"the reward's receiver"}},"vaultRewardBatch(address,(address,uint256)[])":{"custom:function-name":"vaultRewardBatch","custom:sub-param":"`receiver` - receiver's address`amount` - amount of reward","details":"this function is used to interact with a target vault's batch target reward function","params":{"receivers":"the reward receiver's info","targetVault":"the target vault addControllerRole(uint8,address).details: this function is used to add controller roles with ease in place of grantRole

call(address,bytes).details: this function is used to call other contracts from the controller contract

params.targetContract: the target contract being called by the controller

returns._0: data the return data from the call

callBatch((address,bool,bytes)[]).custom:sub-param: `target` - the target contract`allowFailure` - whether to allow failure or not`callData` - the call data to pass on the call
callBatch((address,bool,bytes)[]).details: this function is used to batch call other contracts using multicall3

params.calls: an array of multicall3 call parameters

callBatchValue((address,bool,uint256,byt.custom:sub-param: `target` - the target contract`allowFailure` - whether to allow failure or not`value` - the msg.value or the ETH amount to send`callData` - the call data to pass on the call
callBatchValue((address,bool,uint256,byt.details: this function is used to batch call other contracts using multicall3 with value

params.calls: an array of multicall3 call with value parameters

changeControllerOwner(address).details: this function is used to tranfer ownership and all roles from one account to another while also removing all permissions on the previous account

constructor.details: _disableInitializers prevents future reinitializations [_disableInitializers](https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/5.x/api/proxy#Initializable-_disableInitializers--) for more info

createVault(address,address,address,stri.details: this function is used by the controller to create vaults on behalf of the users

params.projectName: the project name of the vault
params.rewardToken: the erc20 token address to reward users with
params.targetVaultFactory: the address of the vault factory used to create the vault

returns._0: vault the address of the created vault

feeReceiver().details: this function is used to get the current fee receiver set on the controller contract

returns._0: reeReceiver the fee receiver used as reference for fee receivers on factory generated contracts that's called by the controller contract

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

hasControllerRole(uint8,address).details: this function is used to check if an account has a specific controller role

returns._0: hasControllerRole the bool result if the controller has the role

initialize(address,address,address).details: this is used in palce of a constructor to initialize a proxy's state using this implemetation's logic

params.initialAdmin: the admin account | Recommended to be a Multi-Sig Wallet
params.initialBot: the bot that will interact with the controller

multicallAddress().details: this function is used to check which multicall contract the controller is using

returns._0: multicall the multicall address the controller is using

owner().details: this function shows the current owner/admin of the contract

returns._0: owner address of the current owner/admin of the contract

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

removeControllerRole(uint8,address).details: this function is used to remove controller roles with ease in place of revokeRole

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setFeeReceiver(address).details: this function is used to change the fee receiver address

setMulticallAddress(address).details: this function is used to change the multicall contract address used by the contract

transferERC20Token(address,address,uint2.details: this function is used to transfer ERC20 tokens owned by the controller contract to another address

params.amount: the amount of tokens to send

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

vaultReward(address,address,uint256).details: this function is used to interact with a target vault's single target reward function

params.amount: the amount of reward to send

vaultRewardBatch(address,(address,uint25.details: this function is used to interact with a target vault's batch target reward function
